subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Questions About Cole's Funny Picture Book
msgSnippet: Jeff: I just got your e-mail today as I was on vacation.  I learned QS directly from Kingsley Read s manual.  If you can find a copy of the Cole book, I would
messageBody:
Jeff:
 
I just got your e-mail today as I was on vacation.  I learned QS directly from Kingsley Read's manual.  If you can find a copy of the Cole book, I would say buy it, but I do not believe you actually need it since the manual discusses all the fine points needed to achieve fluency.
 
You might try writing in QS on this site:  www.shavian.org/hugh/ikonboard.  I think this would give you the best practice in developing QS fluency.  This board was recently put into use.  The ikonboard at cookeys.net will be shut down soon.  I was surprised that of the forty or so people who are signed on to Read_Alphabet, virtually no one has gone to either site to try their hand at writing QS.
 
Good luck,
 
Paige
----- Original Message -----
From: jeff_smith_8992
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, April 21, 2002 11:16 PM
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Questions About Cole's Funny Picture Book

Hello,
I'm a new member and I'm just learning QuickScript.  I really
appreciate all the easily accessible information that's available
here and elsewhere on the web... I've read the Quickscript Manual (at
least through the "junior" part) and I've skimmed through most of 
this eGroup's past posts.

I've been gradually memorizing the alphabet over the past few weeks
(using the "Revised Shaw Alphabet of Kingsley Read", by Jon Zuck) and
I have several things that I'm unclear about.  But before I post my
questions, I'd like to make sure they haven't already been answered
in the available QuickScript documents.

I have seen many references to "Cole's Funny Picture Book No.2", but
I haven't been able to locate any sources for this book.  I've
searched all my usual on-line bookstores (Amazon, Alibris, ABE, etc)
and I've had a few "close encounters", but I haven't been able to
find the exact book (1979, 71st surprise edition).  So I was
wondering whether anyone can tell me where I might locate a copy. 
Perhaps even more valuable, can anyone offer advice about whether
finding and reading this book would really be worthwhile for a
beginner?

Thank you,
Jeff Smith
